title: Drawing, "Design for Console and Two Side Tables", 1933
medium: Graphite, color pencil on tracing paper
inscribed: Lower right margin: COMBINATIONS FOR BRIDGE FURNITURE/ MAY 6th 1933/.SCALE: 1" = 1'0." JB (initials)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description:
Left: Console table consisting of 7 vertical boxes, 3 with doors, 4 with open shelves, descending in size, resting on a horizontal base. Top possibly marble. Floral basket with two tall leaf arrangements decorate top of console. 
Center: Tall Side table in base consisting of 6 horizontal boxes, some with knobs, tall leafy arrangements decorates top. 
Right: Tall side table on base consisting of 3 vertical boxes, center box on base, side boxes attached and suspended from center box. Three floral arrangements decorate top of unit.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Console and Two Side Tables", 1933.
1933. Graphite, color pencil on tracing paper. Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 2003-15-10.
